column4: what man pages should I read to learn how to connect to a wireless network from the command line?
interfaces
and iwconfig
ok thanks! any more?
make sure you have the right packages installed
basically you get your wireless to show up under iwconfig and ifconfig then edit /etc/network/interfaces to get it to work
then /etc/init.d/networking start ?
I have done wireless for a while but if you look for slightly older debian how-tos they work for ubuntu
haven't I mean
how do I make ther changes to the /etc/networks/interfaces file take effect?
ifdown [networkinterface like eth0 or wlan0], then ifup [thesame]
oh ok. Thanks!
you can man those to I think to learn them,  in your interfaces file if you set the network interface as auto it will connect when you reboot
ok thanks!
